Package org.cesecore.keys.token.p11

Class P11Slot

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.keys.token.p11.P11Slot
  • public class P11Slot
extends Object
    Each instance of this class represents a slot on a P11 module. Use an instance of this class for all your access of a specific P11 slot. Use getProvider() to get a provider for the slot.
    Version:
    $Id: P11Slot.java 30502 2018-11-14 13:44:43Z anatom $

      • getInstance

        public static P11Slot getInstance​(String slotLabel,
                                  String sharedLibrary,
                                  Pkcs11SlotLabelType slotLabelType,
                                  String attributesFile,
                                  P11SlotUser token,
                                  int id,
                                  boolean addProvider)
                           throws CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                  NoSuchSlotException
        Get P11 slot instance. Only one instance (provider) will ever be created for each slot regardless of how many times this method is called.
        Parameters:
        slotLabel - the labeling of the slot, regardless of label type.
        sharedLibrary - file path of shared
        slotLabelType - The type of the label. May be a slot number [0...9]*, slot index i[0...9]* or a label.
        attributesFile - Attributes file. Optional. Set to null if not used
        token - Token that should use this object
        id - unique ID of the user of the token. For EJBCA this is the caid. For the OCSP responder this is fixed since then there is only one user.
        addProvider - default value should be true, set to false to create a P11 slot without actually adding the P11 provider to Java Security
        Returns:
        P11Slot
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if token can not be activated
        NoSuchSlotException - if no slot with the label defined by slotLabel could be found

      • getInstance

        public static P11Slot getInstance​(String friendlyName,
                                  String slotLabel,
                                  String sharedLibrary,
                                  Pkcs11SlotLabelType slotLabelType,
                                  String attributesFile,
                                  P11SlotUser p11SlotUser,
                                  int id,
                                  boolean addProvider)
                           throws NoSuchSlotException,
                                  CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Get P11 slot instance. Only one instance (provider) will ever be created for each slot regardless of how many times this method is called.
        Parameters:
        friendlyName - name to identify the instance
        slotLabel - the labeling of the slot, regardless of label type.
        sharedLibrary - file path of shared
        slotLabelType - The type of the label. May be a slot number [0...9]*, slot index i[0...9]* or a label.
        attributesFile - Attributes file. Optional. Set to null if not used
        p11SlotUser - Token that should use this object
        id - unique ID of the user of the token. For EJBCA this is the caid. For the OCSP responder this is fixed since then there is only one user.
        addProvider - default value should be true, set to false to create a P11 slot without actually adding the P11 provider to Java Security
        Returns:
        P11Slot
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if token can not be activated
        NoSuchSlotException - if no slot by the given label could be found

      • getInstance

        public static P11Slot getInstance​(String sunP11ConfigFileName,
                                  P11SlotUser p11SlotUser,
                                  int id,
                                  boolean addProvider)
                           throws NoSuchSlotException,
                                  CryptoTokenOfflineException
        As getInstance(String, String, Pkcs11SlotLabelType, String, P11SlotUser, int, boolean) but is using config file instead parameters. Do only use this method if the P11 shared library is ony specified in this config file.
        Parameters:
        sunP11ConfigFileName - name of config file
        p11SlotUser - Token that should use this object.
        id - unique ID of the user of the token. For EJBCA this is the caid. For the OCSP responder this is fixed since then there is only one user.
        addProvider - default value should be true, set to false to create a P11 slot without actually adding the P11 provider to Java Security
        Returns:
        a new P11Slot instance
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - on fail
        NoSuchSlotException - if no slot defined by the label in configFileName could be found.
